channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Opportunities in the Evolving Cannabis Consumption Market
item.description: For investors in the space, the changing cannabis consumption landscape opens challenges and opportunities in product creation, marketing, and targeting new consumer groups.

item.title: People are getting rich in Dubai despite Middle East conflict
item.description: Dubai's economy is buzzing with tourism and construction as it positions itself as a safe haven in a region that's resting on a knife’s edge.

item.title: Arizona law requiring proof of citizenship to vote supported by 24 state AGs in emergency stay with SCOTUS
item.description: An emergency application filed in support of HB 2492 in Arizona would require everyone to show proof of citizenship to vote, even with mail-in ballots.

item.title: Three vulnerable Democratic senators will skip DNC
item.description: The three most vulnerable Democratic incumbent senators are reportedly skipping the party's convention next week.

item.title: Good Riddance to Minouche Shafik
item.description: Columbia has an opportunity to behave like an elite American college, but only if the outgoing president’s successors can grasp what she did not.

item.title: Here’s How The Media Are Lying Right Now: ‘Violent Crime Dropping’ Edition
item.description: Democrats and the news media are claiming 'violent crime' is down. That's possibly true, but looting, carjacking, and theft are up.

item.title: From Sandpiles to Angel Investments
item.description: The presence of power law returns in angel investing, with the potential for significant contributions from a handful of investments, has implications for portfolio construction, investment strategies, and diversification.

item.title: Investors, entrepreneurs, and good ideas are becoming collateral damage as the U.S. and China battle over dual-use tech
item.description: Nearly every civilian technology could be adapted to have military applications, which makes innovation increasingly complex and contentious.

item.title: Critics blast Harris' grasp of inflation, attack on business ahead of policy speech: 'Lunatic behavior'
item.description: Vice President Harris will unveil her economic plan Friday, striking out against corporate "price gouging," a tack conservative detractors say ignores the real causes of inflation.

item.title: Texas, Heritage Foundation sue to stop Biden administration's 'transgender mandate' in workplace
item.description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton is seeking to block the Biden administration's transgender directive, a newly enacted policy requiring employers to use the opposite-sex pronouns of male-born workers who identify as female and allow them access to women's restrooms and locker rooms.

item.title: The Conversation — Wiretapping America’s Soul
item.description: Coppola’s 1974 movie brings back social conscience.

item.title: Extreme And Deceptive Abortion Until Birth Amendments Make The Ballot In Arizona, Missouri
item.description: Most U.S. adults oppose abortion until birth, but voters in 8 states might permit abortion through all 9 months via radical amendments.

item.title: Book Review: Pause to Think
item.description: This book is direct, delightful, and articulate in suggesting that we take a slow rather than fast approach to getting things thoughtfully done. It touches the minds and hearts of investment professionals.

item.title: Mpox: Here’s what we know about the virus, and what might be done to contain it
item.description: The World Health Organization warned the virus might ultimately spill across international borders.

item.title: Minnesota business owners sound alarm on Harris' 'nightmare' VP pick : 'Really bad for the US'
item.description: Small business owners in Minnesota said that it has been a "nightmare" working under Gov. Tim Walz's leadership.

item.title: Trump to resume outdoor rallies with bulletproof glass after Secret Service makes exception
item.description: Former President Donald Trump will reportedly return to outdoor rallies -- but with one change.

item.title: The Ukrainian Invasion of Russia Is a Game-Changer
item.description: The Kursk offensive’s success will strengthen Ukraine’s hand in any future negotiations with the Kremlin.

item.title: Report: Secret Service Agent Abandoned Post During Trump Rally To Breastfeed
item.description: A female Secret Service agent assigned to protect former President Donald Trump at a recent rally left her post to breastfeed her child without proper approval, according to a new report. Citing sources within the agency, RealClearPolitics (RCP) reporter Susan Crabtree revealed Thursday that an agent tasked with defending Trump at the former president’s Wednesday […]

item.title: Is Illiquidity a Blessing in Disguise for Some Investors?
item.description: Rather than running away from illiquidity, investment professionals, investors, and regulators alike should recognize its potential benefits and consider a more balanced approach.

item.title: Ed Sheeran bought a 1.4% stake in his boyhood Premier League club Ipswich Town, bagging him executive suite access
item.description: The minority 1.4% stake won't see Sheeran join the board, but will secure him access to an executive box.

item.title: 'Rent is too damn high': Rosen panned for Biden-aligned votes, high housing costs
item.description: Rosen is being targeted for high housing costs and continued inflation after voting in favor of President Biden's spending bill that sought to ease economic struggles during COVID-19.

item.title: What to know about Tim Walz's 1995 drunken driving arrest and how he responded
item.description: Now that Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz is Vice President Kamala Harris ' running mate, his drunken driving arrest from 1995 in Nebraska - long before he entered politics - is getting renewed scrutiny.

item.title: J. D. Vance’s One-Track Mind for Railroad Regulation
item.description: A mandate backed by the VP hopeful wouldn’t make trains any safer, but it would damage the ability of the rail industry to pursue automation.

item.title: Biden’s Land Grab Crusade Thwarts Bipartisan Efforts To Develop Housing On Federal Land
item.description: Lawmakers have set their sights on a long-time solution to a nationwide housing shortage: federal land.

item.title: Scenario Planning, Foresight, and the Power of Imagination: Navigating an Uncertain Future
item.description: By fostering resilience through the consideration of various outcomes, investment practitioners can better anticipate and manage the complexities and disruptions that characterize today's dynamic environment.

item.title: Bavarian Nordic gearing up to produce 10 million doses of mpox vaccine as ‘further imported cases’ in Europe are coming, WHO warns
item.description: Sweden announced the first mpox case outside Africa, the day after the WHO declared a global health emergency.

item.title: Trump conducts no-holds-barred press conference while Harris continues dodging media
item.description: Former President Trump held yet another hours-long press conference Thursday—his second this month—in an effort to draw a stark contrast between his candidacy and his opponent.

item.title: Trump shakes up campaign staff and intensifies attacks on Harris, warning of economic 'nightmare'
item.description: Former President Donald Trump said amid a campaign shake-up Thursday that Vice President Kamala Harris is a proven failure on economic issues and, if she is elected this fall, the "worst is yet to come."

item.title: The Week: Trump’s Slip in the Polls
item.description: Plus: Ukraine’s surprise invasion of Russian territory.

item.title: Thousands Of Noncitizens On U.S. Voter Rolls Assure Americans The Next Election Will Be Unsafe And Unfair
item.description: Even as conservatives push for election integrity, Democrats deny that noncitizens vote while seeking to expand voting rights to noncitizens.
